titlestmt.titleproper: Partial Inventory of the Jefferson Jones collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-10-19T12:37-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: October 19, 2016: Revised to add rehoused photograph materials

did.abstract: Photographs, drawings, printed matter, and miscellanea, relating to activities of the Japanese Army in China during World War I, especially to the siege of Tsingtao, 1914; to the Russo-Japanese War of 1904-1905; and to the palace of Kaiser Wilhelm II on the island of Corfu.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jefferson Jones collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1959.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the library catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Photographs, drawings, printed matter, and miscellanea, relating to activities of the Japanese Army in China during World War I, especially to the siege of Tsingtao, 1914; to the Russo-Japanese War of 1904-1905; and to the palace of Kaiser Wilhelm II on the island of Corfu.

did.unittitle: Printed matter, and miscellanea, relating to activities of the Japanese Army in China during World War I
Photographs and post cards depicting activities of the Japanese Army in China during World War I, the siege of Tsingtao, and the palace of Kaiser Wilhelm II on the island of Corfu,
17 Japanese ink drawings depicting activities of the Japanese Army and Navy during the Russo-Japanese War, 1904-1905
